applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to this document for several reasons: 1) The document is a set of pension scheme rules that outline the structure, benefits, and administration of a pension life cover scheme. It does not contain any content about digital platforms or preselected options for consumer interactions. 2) While the document mentions that customers can use the AIB Mobile Banking app to view documents and update details (Section 6), it does not describe any process requiring consumers to confirm they have read or understood information through preselected options. 3) The document is purely informational and administrative in nature, defining the legal framework of the pension scheme rather than describing consumer interaction processes. The regulation specifically addresses digital platform interactions and preselected confirmations, which are not present in this scheme rules document.
regulation_title: Provision of certain preselected options prohibited
regulation_text: 39. Where a regulated entity is engaging with a consumer by means of a digital platform, for the purposes of providing the consumer with a financial service, the regulated entity shall not provide preselected options to the consumer which indicate that the con sumer has confirmed that the consumer has read or understood information provided by the regulated entity in relation to the financial service.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
